column1: Kalachinsk (Russian: Кала́чинск) is a town in Omsk Oblast
column3: located on the Om River along the busiest segment of the Trans-Siberian Railway
column5: the administrative center of the oblast. Population: 23

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Kalachinsk serves as the administrative center of Kalachinsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the town of oblast significance of Kalachinsk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the town of oblast significance of Kalachinsk is incorporated within Kalachinsky Municipal District as Kalachinsk Urban Settlement.

column1: In the Soviet days of restricted commerce
column2: the town acquired local fame for its weekend market. Fueled by visitors from Kalachinsk arriving by elektrichkas (trains) to Omsk
column3: the Omsk open-air flea markets thrived here.

column1: There are two new agricultural plants built in the town.
